newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Basle - Fed's McDonough says U.S. growth slowing.
newsitem.headline: Basle - Fed's McDonough says U.S. growth slowing.

text.p: New York Federal Reserve President William McDonough said on Monday it appeared as though U.S. economic growth was slowing in the second quarter.
Speaking to reporters on the fringes of the annual meeting of the Bank for International Settlements, McDonough also said the wages data from the U.S. were not a cause for concern.
"We had very strong growth in the fourth quarter and in the first quarter. And it looks as if the second quarter is slowing down," McDonough said.
"Most of us feel that the world economy is functioning very well," he added.
The BIS meeting is attended by central bankers from all over the world.
